conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C.
State A: p_A = p_0, V_A = V_0; State B: p_B = 0.6p_0, V_B = V_0; State C: p_C = 0.6p_0, V_C = 0.5V_0.
Temperature at state A is T_A = U_A/a.
Temperature at state C is T_C = U_C/a.
For state A: T_A = p_0 V_0/R.
Work done by the gas from B to C is W_{BC} = -0.3p_0 V_0.
